profiles:
Summary A software professional with a track record of success in product development and management. Experienced in marketing and delivery of profitable and innovative products. Specialties:Personnel management experience as manager, director, and VP, in growing, shrinking and merging organizations. Hands-on software development experience using agile methodologies. 
 
Software engineering experience in test-driven development, Scrum, eXtreme Programming (XP), Rational Unified Process (RUP), continuous integration, and software inspections. 
 
Technical experience in Microsoft Windows, Linux, C, C++, Perl, Visual Basic, C#, VB.NET, SQL Server 2000, Ruby on Rails, and MySQL. Experience Sr. Product Manager Intel Corporation 2011  – Present (4 years) Ownership of whole-product solution for the Intel’s Pentium series of microprocessors. Mange a team of 15 cross-functional entities. I am responsible for defining product positioning, creating compelling value propositions, developing a packaging/licensing strategy, devising a consistent naming scheme for the various components of the offering and technical enablement initiatives, and assisting product teams in qualifying business opportunities. Product Manager Intel Corporation 2006  –  2010  (4 years) Led a multi-discipline team that oversaw all rudiments of managing the architecture management & construction products for Intel’s Pentium series. Software Engineer Intel Corporation 1999  –  2005  (6 years) Worked on large-scale, real-world experience with onboard and ground-based software applications for the Xeon microprocessors. This experience exposed me to a lot of programming skillsets in C/C#/JAVA/Hadoop. Summary I want to simplify people's lives with software and transform how people get things done online.  
 
FundMyGroup.org and WineClubGuide.com are examples of online services I founded and grew. I'm currently working on growing the ecosystem and marketplace at Atlassian (makers of JIRA, HipChat, BitBucket, and Confluence).  
 
I really enjoy new ideas, startups, working with engineers on new products, and finding creative ways to aquire users. I've learned about product management, product marketing, online marketing, and growth hacking at Berkeley, Wharton, Intel, a couple startups, and now Atlassian.  
 
Follow me on Twitter: @pafries Summary I want to simplify people's lives with software and transform how people get things done online.  
 
FundMyGroup.org and WineClubGuide.com are examples of online services I founded and grew. I'm currently working on growing the ecosystem and marketplace at Atlassian (makers of JIRA, HipChat, BitBucket, and Confluence).  
 
I really enjoy new ideas, startups, working with engineers on new products, and finding creative ways to aquire users. I've learned about product management, product marketing, online marketing, and growth hacking at Berkeley, Wharton, Intel, a couple startups, and now Atlassian.  
 
Follow me on Twitter: @pafries I want to simplify people's lives with software and transform how people get things done online.  
 
FundMyGroup.org and WineClubGuide.com are examples of online services I founded and grew. I'm currently working on growing the ecosystem and marketplace at Atlassian (makers of JIRA, HipChat, BitBucket, and Confluence).  
 
I really enjoy new ideas, startups, working with engineers on new products, and finding creative ways to aquire users. I've learned about product management, product marketing, online marketing, and growth hacking at Berkeley, Wharton, Intel, a couple startups, and now Atlassian.  
 
Follow me on Twitter: @pafries I want to simplify people's lives with software and transform how people get things done online.  
 
FundMyGroup.org and WineClubGuide.com are examples of online services I founded and grew. I'm currently working on growing the ecosystem and marketplace at Atlassian (makers of JIRA, HipChat, BitBucket, and Confluence).  
 
I really enjoy new ideas, startups, working with engineers on new products, and finding creative ways to aquire users. I've learned about product management, product marketing, online marketing, and growth hacking at Berkeley, Wharton, Intel, a couple startups, and now Atlassian.  
 
Follow me on Twitter: @pafries Experience Head of Product Marketing, Ecosystem & Marketplace Atlassian November 2014  – Present (10 months) San Francisco Bay Area Develop and manage GTM plan for ecosystem and marketplace.atlassian.com.  
 Founder OC2 Media 2013  –  January 2015  (2 years) • Founded several online publications. Developed marketing and content strategy. Designed agile processes to grow the company, including partner marketing, search marketing, online advertising, content development, budgeting, and web development. 
 
• Generated millions in lead revenue for high profile partners like the Wall Street Journal, Virgin, Philips, and ADT Home Security. Co-Founder FundMyGroup August 2013  –  March 2014  (8 months) • Co-founded new fund-raising service. Defined new service, managed software developers, developed branding, created marketing communications, and oversaw go to market plan.  
 
• Formed strategic partnerships with over 100 online retailers, including Wal-Mart, Target, Lowes, Groupon, and Staples. Product Manager Intel Corporation 2010  –  2013  (3 years) Americas Datacenter Marketing • Owned and developed the marketing plan for Intel's data center volume and mission critical segments in the Americas region 
 
• Led several high profile product launches in the Americas, including the extremely successful launch of the Intel E5 Xeon Processor which generated over $6B in 2013 revenue. 
 
• Extensive partner marketing experience, including co-marketing with Dell, HP, IBM, Cisco, Lenovo, Microsoft, Redhat, VMware, Thomson Reuters, BMW, Oracle, SAP, Fujitsu, Novartis, and DuPont.  
 
• Managed $MM+ marketing budget with 10X+ return on investment. Marketing tactics included partner marketing, social media, events, sponsorships, online advertising, case studies, sales training and promotions.  
 
• Founded several marketing programs, including the 'Path to the Cloud’ program which drove sales of Intel processors in cloud infrastructure via resellers. Also created the Accelerated Sales Campaign that drove sales of high end processors. 
 
• Managed Intel’s sponsorship of several industry events, including the Gartner Datacenter Conference. Grew awareness for Intel's Data Center product portfolio with CIOs and IT decision markers in the Americas, including most Fortune 500 CIOs. Market Development Manager Intel Corporation 2008  –  2009  (1 year) North America HP Account Team • Owned the joint HP-Intel small business segment marketing plan. Managed numerous sales and marketing programs, including strategic pricing and proof of concepts.  
 
• Established a new marketing program in HP's reseller network to ramp Intel's vPro technology, which increased vPro revenue by 3.5X in Q4'08. Also developed a sell-up sales program which delivered $100MM+ in incremental revenue. 
 
• Managed sponsorship budget and oversaw Intel's participation in 6 HP conferences. Grew brand and product awareness with thousands of HP and HP partner reps for several strategic products, including vPro, quad core and 45 nanometer technology. 
 
• Worked with HP's call center in 2008 to establish new sales programs and to bring on-board on-site Intel experts, resulting in $10MM+ in incremental revenue that year. Marketing Manager Intel Corporation 2007  –  2007  (less than a year) North America Channel • Managed a server marketing program designed to energize and educate thousands of channel customers in 37 cities across N. America, resulting in a 105% increase in Q3’07 to Q4’07 sales and a 35x ROI. Product Manager Intel Corporation 2006  –  2006  (less than a year) Worldwide Consumer Devices • Managed worldwide cross-functional team of 30+, including QA, account managers and marketing in Japan, China, France, and the US, delivering 25 Viiv verified devices to market and 3.8 million Viiv PCs. Senior Software Engineer Overwaitea Food Group - Jim Patterson Group - Save On Foods 2001  –  2003  (2 years) • Responsible for gathering business requirements and developing software applications at the largest retail chain in Western Canada. Involved in several modernization projects, including supply chain, finance, loyalty, and POS.  
 
• Critical contributor on a team that was awarded and recognized by the President for implementing the most successful IT project of the year, which led to a cost savings of $600k per annum Head of Product Marketing, Ecosystem & Marketplace Atlassian November 2014  – Present (10 months) San Francisco Bay Area Develop and manage GTM plan for ecosystem and marketplace.atlassian.com.

Summary Proven, results-oriented leader with strong track record predicting long-term market inflection points and opportunities. Experienced in forming a crystal clear vision for the organization, creating disruptive technologies and matching them to a business strategy, then building a strong, high functioning team to transform innovation into winning products. 
 
Specialties 
Delivering results in fast changing, competitive markets.Long term in-depth market see-through & strategic analysis. Technology & business innovation. Broad experience in defining winning products. Building highly energetic A-teams. Good know-how across complete range of functions inclusive of engineering, marketing, branding, business development and general management.
